intro: Psychotria trifida, commonly known as the Trinidad psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Trinidad and Tobago, as well as parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. Psychotria trifida is also noted for its association with certain species of epiphytic plants and its role in local ecosystems.
